member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.MarginBase
member.summary: An abstract base class for creating classes that provide an implementation for an Margin.

remarks.para: This is the base class for all Margins - built-in and custom. To create a custom Margin, derive a class from this class and override the property and implement the interface members to control your margin's position within that location. In addition you should override the method and return a FrameworkElement derived element that will serve as the Margin's representation in the UI. To let the know about your custom Margin, simply add an instance of your derived class to the collection.
The built-in Margins are automatically created by the and together with any you have specified are arranged and displayed in one of the four Margin areas based on their property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.XamSyntaxEditor.CustomMargins
member.summary: Returns the collection of custom Margins displayed by each (read only).

remarks.para: Custom Margins are classes that derive from the abstract base class . This collection only contains the custom Margins you create and add to the collection. The built-in Margins are created automatically by the control, and you can control whether or not they appear using their associated 'IsVisible' properties.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.XamSyntaxEditor.ErrorDisplayMode
member.summary: Returns/sets whether the control displays error squigglies under text that violates the 's Language grammar rules.

remarks.para: When set to false the control will not allow selected text to be dragged within the control or outside the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.XamSyntaxEditor.InactiveDocumentView
member.summary: Returns the current inactive , or null if there is no inactive view (read only).

remarks.para: The active is the view with the keyboard focus. An additional view can be created by splitting the active view.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.XamSyntaxEditor.IsLineNumberMarginVisible
member.summary: Returns/sets whether line numbers are displayed in the left Margin for every document line. The default is true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.XamSyntaxEditor.IsRulerMarginVisible
member.summary: Returns/sets whether a column positions ruler is displayed in the top Margin. The default is false.

remarks.para: The ruler displays tick marks for each display column. The width of the display columns is based on the average width of a character rendered with the current font. As a result, the ruler is only useful when the is using a fixed width font. In fact, if you choose to display the ruler when the control is using a proportional font, the ruler's column positions will not align with the character positions in the text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.XamSyntaxEditor.SplitOptions
member.summary: Returns/sets whether mini-splitters are displayed in the scrollbar areas to allow the end user to split the editing area of the control. The default is .

remarks.para: Note: This property only controls whether the end user can split the editing area (via the mini splitters in the scrollbar areas) and does not affect the ability to programmatically split the editing area by setting the property.

Note: If the is placed in a container element that measures its children with an infinite height or width (e.g., a StackPanel), then certain settings of this property will be considered 'invalid' and will be resolved to an appropriate setting. member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.XamSyntaxEditor.WhitespaceIndicatorBrush
member.summary: Returns/sets the Brush used to color the indicators which are rendered to highlight the presence of whitespace (i.e., tabs and spaces) in the document text.
member.remarks: This property defaults to null. Refer to the property to see how the final color for rendering the whitespace indicators is determined.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.XamSyntaxEditor.WhitespaceIndicatorBrushResolved
member.summary: Returns the property if non-null, otherwise returns the Foreground color specified for the entry in the (read only).
member.remarks: By default the whitespace indicators will be rendered using the Foreground brush specified for the entry in the since the property defaults to null. However, when the property is set to a non-null value it takes precedence and will be used to render the whitespace indicators.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.XamSyntaxEditor.WhitespaceIndicatorVisibility
member.summary: Returns/sets whether indicators are rendered along with the document text to indicate the presence of whitespace (i.e., tabs and spaces). The default is Collapsed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.XamSyntaxEditor.ZoomLevel
member.summary: Returns/sets the zoom level for the text area of the control. The text and all Margins are included in the zoom area - the scrollbars are not included.

remarks.para: Note: This value is expressed as a percentage with 1.0 being 100%. Valid values are from .2 to 4.0.
To zoom the text area when running in the Browser (Silverlight or WPF) press the SHIFT key and scroll the mousewheel. When running outside the Browser press the CTRL key and scroll the mousewheel.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.XamSyntaxEditor.ZoomLevelAsPercentage
member.summary: Returns the value of the property expressed as a percentage. (read-only)

remarks.para: For example, if the is set to 1.0, this property will return 100.
